heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 21 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.6°C) and outside temperature (down 1.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 2.0°C), rainfall (down 0.1 mm), and feels like temperature (up 2.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 214.3m higher than yesterday, 23.4m lower than the past week, 308.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 697m and a high of 1474m, averaging 1169.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and very little to no wind will be present. Periods of rain anticipated, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and bright intervals likely. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (90%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
